variant.question: The Air Navigation Commission consists of:

options.text: ICAO's mission is to serve as the global forum of States for international civil aviation. ICAO develops policies and Standards, undertakes compliance audits, performs studies and analyses, provides assistance and builds aviation capacity through many other activities and the cooperation of its Member States and stakeholders.

ICAOâ€™s mission is to represent, lead and serve the airline industry. ICAO seeks to improve understanding of the industry among decision makers and increase awareness of the benefits that aviation brings to national and global economies. It fights for the interests of airlines across the globe, challenging unreasonable rules and charges, holding regulators and governments to account, and striving for sensible regulation.
ICAO's mission is to approve new international airlines and aircraft.
ICAO produces rules and regulations, and promotes the highest common standards of civil aviation safety and environmental protection in Europe and worldwide.

variant.question: Which of the following ICAO documents contain International Standards and Recommended Practices (SARPS)?

options.text: Annexes to the Convention on international civil aviation.
ICAO Technical Manuals.
Procedures for Air Navigation Services (PANS).
Regional Supplementary Procedures (SUPPS).
